content.quote: The use of COBOL cripples the mind; its teaching should, therefore, be regarded as a criminal offense.
content.author: Edsgar Dijkstra

content.quote: Whenever I climb I am followed by a dog called 'Ego'.
content.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content.quote: Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.
content.author: Albert Einstein

content.quote: I think 'Hail to the Chief' has a nice ring to it.
content.author: John F. Kennedy

content.quote: I begin by taking. I shall find scholars later to demonstrate my perfect right.
content.author: Frederick (II) the Great

content.quote: He is one of those people who would be enormously improved by death.
content.author: H. H. Munro

content.quote: Everybody pities the weak; jealousy you have to earn.
content.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

content.quote: Try to learn something about everything and everything about something.
content.author: Thomas Henry Huxley

content.quote: All are lunatics, but he who can analyze his delusion is called a philosopher.
content.author: Ambrose Bierce
